channel.title: Need help running server on laptop
channel.description: ok so i ran my server on my desktop and it worked fine but since i hooked up my router and moved my server on to my laptop i cannot get the server portforwarded and my desktop wont run it if my router is plugged in any help? on windows 7

item.title: Need help running server on laptop
item.dc:creator: @Aceron4 Aceron4
item.description:
@Aceron4 wrote:

mashamaru:

umm for this just open cmd (command prompt) type ipconfig and type ur ip in ur url bar then do ur firewall stuff

Im running Windows 7 like the OP is. And I tend to have trouble with the ipconfig on my cmd. So what I normally do is open up my Network and Sharing center, then click on the wireless connection Im connected to and then click on the “Details” button on the little window that pops. That window has really everything you need to know including the IPv4 address which is needed when portforwarding.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help running server on laptop

item.title: Need help running server on laptop
item.dc:creator: @Barrick Barrick
item.description:
@Barrick wrote:

This happened to me before, later like 5 days after I took off my portfoward made a new one, and hooked up to my server and works on all my computers.

&

You could try using your Ipv4Connectivity

item.title: Need help running server on laptop
item.dc:creator: @Aceron4 Aceron4
item.description:
@Aceron4 wrote:

Hmm. Guess I should asked for the specific Model (ie. Belkin F1P1242EGau)

But anyways. If you go here http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm Just find your router (after you do just skip the advertisement that pops up) then scroll down and find “Runescape Private Server” and there will be a tut for how to portforward.

If you need any help I can hopefully help you over Team Viewer.

Read full topic
